Summary I am a seasoned Software Engineer that has been designing and developing software since 1995, primarily on the Microsoft stack. I started with Visual C++ 1.0, Visual Basic 3.0 (for Windows) and 1.0 (for DOS), and SQL Server 4.2. 
 
I have followed application development trends from client/server to n-tier to web to mobile to the cloud. Clients started thick, then went thin, then alternated several times between the two. Business logic migrated from stored procedures to COM components to services. Data modeling shifted from 3rd party tools to SQL database diagrams to ORMs. 
 
For a good part of my career I was very active in the Microsoft certification community. From 1996 to 2010, I passed 32 exams and attained (and re-attained) the major developer and database certifications. In 2004 I became a Microsoft Certified Trainer. From 2005 to 2010, I taught 21 developer and database-oriented classes to 265 students, saving my company $435K. 
 
After acquiring vast experience developing enterprise applications and establishing a successful track record of solving complex problems, I am now squarely in the second half of my career. Though I no longer code as often, my project responsibilities have nonetheless increased by managing the project schedule, technical team, customers, and management. 
 
I have been employed by Intel since 2000, and most recently I joined the Internet of Things Group. I am currently part of the development team working on Retail Client Manager (intel.com/rcm), and I am having a lot of fun. I am not looking for any other opportunities at this time. Experience Senior Software Engineer Intel Corporation - Retail Solutions Division (IOTG -> RSD) October 2013  – Present (1 year 11 months) Chandler, Arizona • Part of the development team for Retail Client Manager, Intel's digital content management product. 
• Team Lead for Remote Control capability, which allows browser-based remote management of devices in-band (when the OS is up) and out-of-band through AMT (when the OS is down). Senior Software Engineer Intel Corporation - Design Tools Development (TMG -> ATTD -> Design -> DTD) November 2009  –  October 2013  (4 years) Chandler, Arizona • Repurposed two mature desktop tools for external use by Original Device and Equipment Manufacturers (ODMs and OEMs). The tools validate CAD schematic and layout board files against Intel Platform Design Guidelines and display violations. 
- Architected the solution, managed the projects, and technically led the team comprised of employees and contractors across multiple geographies. Embraced Agile software practices, tracked resources, and reported-out to management regularly. 
- The user interfaces (UIs) are built with ASP.NET MVC 3, AJAX, and jQuery. A file upload control written in Silverlight 5 allows for very large files (hundreds of megabytes) to be uploaded with real-time feedback. The control communicates with multiple Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) 4 services, and uses Entity Framework 4.2 to store files as SQL Server 2008 R2 FILESTREAM data. 
- A managed wrapper, running on multiple application servers, leverages the desktop tools’ enormous CPU-intensive unmanaged code base. 
- Personally developed the queue-based back-end services which connect the tiers. The services are implemented using a manager/worker pattern and are deployed to application servers. They allow asynchronous execution of long-running (several hours) design rule checks, email notifications, and scheduled tasks such as data purging. 
• Chaired technical sharing meetings, oversaw design and code reviews, mentored multiple interns. Recognized outside of group as an expert in Microsoft developer technologies, and sought out by others as a valuable technical resource. 
• Key technologies: ASP.NET, Silverlight with MVVM, jQuery, AJAX, .NET, Windows Communication Foundation (WCF), Entity Framework, LINQ to SQL/XML/Objects, SQL Server 
• Special skills: Agile software development lifecycle (SDLC), asynchronous programming, Windows services guru, managed/unmanaged code integration, server administration Intel U Instructor, Microsoft Developer Technologies Representative Intel Corporation - Multiple training-related groups January 2005  –  April 2010  (5 years 4 months) Chandler, Arizona • Planned, organized, and taught 21 Microsoft courses through Intel U (see full list below) to 265 students which saved Intel $435K. 
• Evangelized internal training and recruited other trainers by presenting the virtues both individually to technical experts (in 1:1s) and various business groups (in staff meetings). 
• Coordinated vendor-led training based on IT demand when my schedule was full. 
• Represented Microsoft developer technologies in the IT Developer Virtual Advisory Team (VAT). 
• Helped define the IT technical training roadmap, forecasted training courses over the next 12-24 months, and specified competencies relevant to IT developers while working within an ever-tightening budget.
